alert.note: Alert for Jewell (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 01 at 6:20PM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of north central Kansas, including the following counties, Jewell and Mitchell. * WHEN...Until 945 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams are expected. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 614 PM CDT, a trained storm spotter reported minor flooding near Scottsville. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have already fallen. An additional inch of rainfall is expected due to thunderstorms moving through the area, but rain should be ending shortly. - This includes the following streams and drainages... West Asher Creek, Buffalo Creek, Lost Creek, Marsh Creek, Plum Creek, Prairie Creek, East Asher Creek, Little Cheyenne Creek, Dry Creek, Spring Creek, West Marsh Creek, Marshall Creek, East Marsh Creek, Mulberry Creek, Fourth Creek, Asher Creek and Browns Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Beloit, Asherville, Simpson, Randall and Scottsville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
